heif.boxes

Class ItemPropertiesBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • heif.boxes.Box
      • heif.boxes.ItemPropertiesBox

  • public class ItemPropertiesBox
extends Box
    Represents the iprp (Item Properties Box) in a HEIF/HEIC file structure.

    The ItemPropertiesBox allows the definition of properties that describe specific characteristics of media items, such as images or auxiliary data. Each property is stored in the ipco (ItemPropertyContainerBox), while associations between items and their properties are managed through one or more ipma (ItemPropertyAssociationBox) entries.

    Box Structure:

    • ipco – Contains an implicitly indexed list of property boxes
    • ipma – Maps items to property indices defined in ipco

    Specification Reference:

    • ISO/IEC 23008-12:2017 (Page 28)

    API Note:This implementation assumes child boxes are non-nested. Additional testing is recommended for nested or complex structures.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemPropertiesBox

        public ItemPropertiesBox(Box box,
                         ByteStreamReader reader)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs an ItemPropertiesBox by reading the ipco (property container) and one or more ipma (item-property association) boxes. The ItemPropertiesBox consists of two parts: ItemPropertyContainerBox that contains an implicitly indexed list of item properties, and one or more ItemPropertyAssociation boxes that associate items with item properties.
        Parameters:
        box - the parent Box header containing size and type
        reader - a ByteStreamReader to read the box content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if malformed data is encountered, such as a negative box size and corrupted data

    • Method Detail

      • getItemPropertyContainerBox

        public ItemPropertiesBox.ItemPropertyContainerBox getItemPropertyContainerBox()
        Returns the reference to the ItemPropertyContainerBox.
        Returns:
        the active ipco box resource

      • getItemPropertyAssociationBox

        public ItemPropertyAssociationBox getItemPropertyAssociationBox()
        Returns the primary ipma box.
        Returns:
        the first ItemPropertyAssociationBox found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no associations exist

      • getAllAssociations

        public java.util.List<ItemPropertyAssociationBox> getAllAssociations()
        Returns an unmodifiable list of all association boxes.
        Returns:
        a list of all ipma resources

      • getPropertyByIndex

        public Box getPropertyByIndex(int index)
        Retrieves a property by its 1-based index from the container.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to retrieve the corresponding property within the ipco box
        Returns:
        the selected property box resource

      • getPropertyListByItem

        public java.util.List<Box> getPropertyListByItem(int itemID)
        Resolves all property boxes associated with a specific item ID.

        This method iterates through all ipma boxes to collect property indices linked to the specified item ID. Indices are 1-based pointers into the ipco container.

        Parameters:
        itemID - the ID of the item, for example: from pitm or infe etc
        Returns:
        a list of associated property boxes, for example: ispe, irot, colr, returns an empty list if no associations are found

      • getBoxList

        public java.util.List<Box> getBoxList()
        Returns a combined list of all boxes contained in this ItemPropertiesBox, including both property container and associations.
        Overrides:
        getBoxList in class Box
        Returns:
        a list of Box objects in reading order

      • logBoxInfo

        public void logBoxInfo()
        Logs the box hierarchy and internal entry data at the debug level.

        It provides a visual representation of the box's HEIF/ISO-BMFF structure. It is intended for tree traversal and file inspection during development and degugging if required.

        Overrides:
        logBoxInfo in class Box
